metadata.synopsis: The player speaks to the doctor and can ask to get their tadpole removed. They can then agree to step into the device to be 'cured', or refuse and have the doctor try to leave and get the guards.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to the doctor in the infirmary in the gith creche.teleport S_CRE_Doctorof goto 1287; -2; -802

41.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
41.text: Are you the 'friend' with the tadpole problem?

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Yes, can you help me get rid of it?

98.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
98.text: Lie down on the zaith'isk, and your troubles will be over.

128.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
128.text: Chk. If you aren't here for treatment, then get out of my infirmary.

60.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
60.text: Vertical incision from pineal eye to end of notochord.
60.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The doctor is leaning forward, peering into a microscope. She is conducting an autopsy on a mindflayer tadople using the gith medical device. 
She uses her hands to psionically twist the orientation of the tadpole in the sphere that holds it. InternalNodeContext: She is absorbed in her work and doesn't react to the player's entry into the room. She knows they're there, but she's more interested in her work than them.NodeContext: dictating to herself

19.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
19.text: Intestinal colouration consistent with samples 231 to 259.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: She zooms the machine's lens in on the body of the dissected tadpole.

56.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
56.text: Do you have a question or are you just going to stand there gawking?
56.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She addresses the player without turning around. 

She turns at the end of her question to see the player's responseNodeContext: nonchalant

217.speaker: Lae'zel
217.text: I am a Child of Gith, not discarded rat-flesh. Am I not due your respect?

197.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
197.text: Perhaps, perhaps not. Let the istik with you speak, and I will decide what respect you are owed.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I'd prefer Lae'zel to speak on my behalf.

22.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
22.text: Lae'zel, is it? Fine - and be quick. My work is of vital import.

215.speaker: Lae'zel
215.text: We carry ghaik tadpoles, and have done so for countless days - yet we show no symptoms. We must enter the zaith'isk.

135.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
135.text: You are infected, but showing no signs of cerebral impairment? Fascinating.

78.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
78.text: The zaith'isk is our last means of defence. It is used for the removal of illithid tadpoles.

134.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
134.text: Why do you want to know?

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I am Lae'zel of K'liir. I come to be purified.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: I require your assistance in removing a tadpole.

157.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
157.text: You must be desperate, to seek my aid.
157.context: NodeContext: obervational, not too smug or opportunistic at this point

142.speaker: Player
142.text: My friend is infected - I'm looking for a way to help them.

218.speaker: Player
218.text: I've never seen one up close. And you seem a favourable teacher.

125.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
125.text: Chk. I have no desire to teach, though your request is understandable.

57.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
57.text: You do not gain true knowledge by demanding it of others. It must be earned.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: What are you hoping to learn from dissecting that thing?

188.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
188.text: Nothing your kind is capable of understanding.
188.context: NodeContext: a statement of fact - not intended to be an insult

206.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
206.text: The better question is - what brings an istik  to my infirmary?

155.speaker: Player
155.text: Is that thing's host still alive?

178.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
178.text: A very specific question, one that speaks of a more personal motivation for asking.
178.context: NodeContext: logical, a bit smug - she's already figured out you're infected

13.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
13.text: I can only deduce... you have a parasite of your own.

187.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
187.text: Tell me, how long have you been infected?

73.speaker: Player
73.text: A few days? I stopped counting when I ran out of fingers.

129.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
129.text: Hmm. A sign that your cognitive abilities are not so robust as they appear.

39.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
39.text: Still, you appear to be functioning far beyond the capacity of others I've observed in your condition. How fascinating.
39.context: NodeContext: curiosity getting the best of her

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Longer than you'd expect ceremorphosis to take. And with none of the symptoms.

35.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
35.text: Fascinating. So you're conscious of your infection, but showing no signs of cerebral impairment.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Too long. Just get this thing out of me.

82.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
82.context: NodeContext: smug, knows that granting this request will kill the player

148.speaker: Player
148.text: I'm not infected. I'm asking for a friend.

63.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
63.text: Ah. Friendship. A curious burden I confess I have no interest in carrying.
63.context: NodeContext: As though "friendship" is a phenomenon to be observed

173.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
173.text: Still, I would not withhold aid if it furthers our collective efforts against the ghaik.

10.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
10.text: And you expected charity from us?

136.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
136.text: You are a unique specimen. All right, my curiosity is piqued.

121.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
121.text: Tell me, how long has your friend been infected?

5.speaker: Player
5.text: A day or two. They seem to be fine so far.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Longer than you'd expect ceremorphosis to take. And with none of the symptoms.

94.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
94.text: I see you have some knowledge of the process.
94.context: InternalNodeContext: She knows the 'friend' is really you. You're the one who's infected.

211.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
211.text: You'll be aware then, that your friend is on borrowed time.

145.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
145.text: Bring them here, and you'll have a live demonstration of what the zaith'isk can do.
145.context: NodeContext: excited at the prospect of using the zaith'isk, knows the zaith'isk will kill them

147.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
147.text: Bring them here for purification. I will be waiting.
147.context: NodeContext: excited at the prospect of using the zaith'isk, knows the zaith'isk will kill them

192.speaker: Player
192.text: I shouldn't have said anything. It's not my place.

87.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
87.text: Come now, no need to be shy. I assure you I'd be delighted to help this 'friend' of yours.

112.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
112.text: If this friend is kin, their cowardice does little to earn my assistance.

7.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
7.text: If not, I question your choice of 'friends'.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I lied, it's me. I'm the one with the tadpole.

50.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
50.text: Is that so? Dishonesty towards your superiors is an ill-advised behaviour.

4.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
4.text: Though I will admit, it's fascinating that you're still able to lie at this stage of infection.
4.context: NodeContext: curiosity getting the best of her

93.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
93.text: I suspected as much. Though I am fascinated that you've retained the ability to lie about it.
93.context: InternalNodeContext: She was waiting for you to come clean. NodeContext: curiosity getting the best of her

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Fine. I'll leave you to it then.

58.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
58.text: If your friend is not capable of asking me directly, I see no reason to get involved.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Not me personally, but my friend does. I'm trying to find a way to help them.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Merely curious. You seem an expert on the subject.

95.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
95.text: Your assumption is correct. My experiments have been vital in supporting our queen's efforts against the ghaik.

194.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
194.text: Few of our kin understand that wars can be fought with science, as well as swords.

79.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
79.text: Chk. Curiosity without toil is like a broken viewing glass: unfocused and incapable of insight.
79.context: InternalNodeContext: She considers your intellect far beneath her, but is prepared to entertain the possibility that she's wrong.

96.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
96.text: Let's see what knowledge your labours have borne so far.

40.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
40.text: Tell me, what is your understanding of ceremorphosis?

0.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
0.text: Chk. Clearly our schooling is not what it used to be.

168.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
168.text: The tadpole is a parasite. Once it consumes enough of your brain matter, it instigates an excruciating transformation.

132.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
132.text: Every fibre, every sinew of your being is torn apart and reformed into the repugnant flesh of a ghaik, or 'illithid'. That is ceremorphosis.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Look, I haven't told you everything. I'm infected...

45.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
45.text: Is that so? Conscious of the tadpole's presence, yet able to pretend otherwise. Fascinating.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Thanks for that. Learn something new every day.

12.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
12.text: A facile achievement for those who know so little to begin with.

66.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
66.text: The stupidity encouraged on this plane never ceases to amaze me. Listen carefully.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: It's the seven day process by which an illithid tadpole eats away the host's brain and takes control of its body.

75.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
75.text: Chk. I see you're somewhat familiar with the material. Though hardly up to date.

52.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
52.text: Unless you have anything new of your own to share, I must get back to my sample. It's drying out.

221.speaker: Player
221.text: Report the details of your own infection, as protocol dictates.

208.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
208.text: Cursed is the day that even we become ghaik incubators.

25.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
25.text: First the nautiloid's arrival, then the ghaik swarming around Moonrise...

185.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
185.text: Though - you are like nothing I've seen before. You remain lucid, when you should have succumbed.
185.context: NodeContext: wheels starting to turn - she's going to experiment on you

8.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
8.text: Infected, and yet capable of maintaining a falsehood. How unusual.
8.context: InternalNodeContext: She's been waiting for you to come clean. NodeContext: her intelligence is validated

37.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
37.text: Much like your decision to seek aid from us. The infestation at Moonrise has created strange bedfellows indeed.

2.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
2.text: You aren't the first istik to require my treatment - though you're the most lucid by some margin.
2.context: NodeContext: trying to sound casual, secretly excited. "treatment" = fatally experimented on

47.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
47.text: Either your tadpole is special, or you are. We must find out which.
47.context: NodeContext: Excited - this is an exciting scientific prospect

23.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
23.text: Go to the zaith'isk. I will ensure you are cured.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: She gestures towards the Zaith'isk. NodeContext: Excited - this is an exciting scientific prospect

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I'm not familiar with the term. What's a zaith'isk?

163.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
163.text: The apparatus at the top of those stairs. Quickly now - time is of the essence.

14.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
14.text: It will relieve you of the specimen lodged in your cerebral cortex. What else?
14.context: NodeContext: knows it will kill the player, amused by their suspicion

139.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
139.text: It will be worth it. I assure you.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: I have waited long for this.

122.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
122.text: Your gratitude is unnecessary. The procedure brings its own rewards.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Actually... Maybe I'll come back later.

1.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
1.text: There are more rudimentary methods of extraction, if you find our technology intimidating.

86.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
86.text: Wait here. I'll require some assistance.
86.context: InternalNodeContext: She's lying - she's actually going to fetch the guards.

46.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
46.text: If you would prefer another extraction method, kin, you have only to ask.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Tell her of the True Souls you've encountered.

53.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
53.text: It sounds like they've discovered a way to exist in a state of suspended ceremorphosis.

117.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
117.text: Only a powerful magic would be able to maintain such a stasis, but the Absolutists we've encountered showed no such ability.

70.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
70.text: You have my thanks for these observations of yours. It seems you have a scientist's eye after all.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Give your observations of the tadpoled Absolutists in Moonrise Towers.

153.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
153.text: So, they are gathering. And in a state of suspended ceremorphosis.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Tell how you vanquished the tadpoled Absolutists in Moonrise Towers.

216.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
216.text: So, they were gathering. And somehow doing so in a state of suspended ceremorphosis.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Relate your 'findings'. Use lots of long, complicated words.

114.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
114.text: Your knowledge betrays a closer experience than you let on. You're infected.

44.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
44.text: So you are not an idiot. But nor are you an intellectual.

165.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
165.text: To be expected. We each have our weapons to wield. Some are sharper than others.
165.context: InternalNodeContext: With no disrespect, but it's clear she considers her craft (science) superior to yours.

118.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
118.text: A shame. I had hopes for you, istik.
118.context: InternalNodeContext: Genuinely disappointed - she's starved of a good intellectual jousting session.

204.speaker: Player
204.text: Mime every disgusting stage of transformation into a mind flayer.

104.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
104.text: What a bizarre display. And yet, surprisingly accurate.
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the doctor's reaction here, one of incredulityInternalNodeContext: Her curiosity gets the better of her - she is thinking out loud. NodeContext: Genuine curiousity

100.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
100.text: You appear to have somatic knowledge of the process, and yet you remain in possession of your cerebral faculties.
100.context: NodeContext: holding back some excitement - this is genuinely new territory. As though making a study of the player

68.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
68.text: You've spent too much time with istiks, kin.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the doctor's reaction here, one of incredulity

141.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
141.text: Come back when you've worked these airs out of your system.

201.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
201.text: Well you certainly have a flair for something.
201.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the doctor's reaction here, one of incredulity

220.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
220.text: But I've more interest in substance than... whatever it is you're trying to offer me.

183.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
183.text: Now go, continue your education elsewhere. You've delayed my work long enough.

115.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
115.text: Very good - you've grasped the basic definition. If I ever misplace my dictionary, I'll know who to ask.

222.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
222.text: Well, whatever matter your skull contains, it clearly isn't cerebral in nature. Ceremorphosis is no threat to you.
222.context: CinematicNodeContext: awkward beat on the player staring at the doctor

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I have first-hand knowledge. I'm infected.

127.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
127.text: True curiosity does not demand answers - it finds them for itself.

198.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
198.text: If it's an education you seek, go to the training room. I'm sure the sa'varsh will be happy to oblige.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: I've been told someone here knows how to remove tadpoles. I'm guessing that's you.

59.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
59.text: Guessing is an idiotic habit. Theorise. Postulate. Deduce. Never guess.
59.context: NodeContext: pet peeve, can't help but correct you

205.speaker: Player
205.text: I've got a tadpole needs removing. Can you help me?

83.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
83.text: If you require treatment, take a seat, kin. Or do you have a question?
83.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She addresses the player without turning around. 

She turns at the end of her question to see the player's response

162.speaker: Lae'zel
162.text: Go on. You know what we require.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I am Lae'zel of K'liir. I have come to be purified.

191.speaker: Player
191.text: What do you hope to gain from dissecting the ghaik spawn?

175.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
175.text: I'm analysing changes in the worm's digestive tract following consumption of cerebral matter.

61.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
61.text: Most of our kin find such work rather tedious. I wonder - what makes you so curious?
61.context: NodeContext: pleased to have had the opportunity to pontificate

169.speaker: Player
169.text: Is that machine a zaith'isk? Is it operational?

64.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
64.text: Operational? It is exemplary. I maintain it myself.
64.context: NodeContext: smug - proud of her equipment

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I have a tadpole of my own needs removing. Can you help with that?

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Are you the ghustil? I've been infected and require purification.

131.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
131.text: You were interested in the zaith'isk.
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: The doctor is conducting an autopsy on a mindflayer tadople. She has her back to the player. She talks over her shoulder to them. InternalNodeContext: She knows they player is there, but she's more interested in her work than them.

140.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: The doctor is conducting an autopsy on a mindflayer tadople. She has her back to the player.InternalNodeContext: She is absorbed in her work and doesn't react to the player's entry into the room. She knows they're there, but she's more interested in her work than them.NodeContext: disengaged

166.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
166.text: Must you keep bothering me? If you have questions, read a book.
166.context: CinematicNodeContext: The doctor is conducting an autopsy on a mindflayer tadople. She has her back to the player.InternalNodeContext: She is absorbed in her work and doesn't react to the player's entry into the room. She knows they're there, but she's more interested in her work than them.NodeContext: disengaged

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I have a confession. I've been tadpoled, and I need help.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: What will the zaith'isk do to them?

161.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
161.text: The specifics are... complicated. It is not a comfortable process, but a necessary one.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: It was me all along - I'm the one who's infected.

181.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
181.text: Is that so? Then of course, you will be treated first. Lie down when you're ready.
181.context: NodeContext: with a smile - she knows the treatment will kill you

30.speaker: Player
30.text: All right, I'll go fetch them.

29.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
29.text: Best not to delay. They may soon be beyond even my capabilities to save.

190.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
190.text: Your presence is not welcome here, k'chakhi.
